result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Ryan Nord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by end of week.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process.  For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. Cannot hold elected office. Other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. No illegal substances.
Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Must complete a COMPAS Evaluation and follow through.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation Agent if necessary. Not subject to good time but subject to work release.

superMiscConds.notes: - May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

- Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
- May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
- If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

- Must follow through with requirements of Extended Supervision.
- Must follow through with any programming.
- Any assessments still owing to be paid through Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
